required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical and Cognitive Performance During the Two First Years of Lemtrada Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Physical and Cognitive Performance During the Two First Years of Lemtrada Treatment - a Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Multiple Sclerosis (MS) is a chronic autoimmune neurodegenerative disease of the central nervous system (CNS). The symptoms of MS are wide-ranging, but patients perceive loss of physical function (gait) and cognitive function as the most critical consequences of the disease. Moreover, recent studies have shown that already at early disease stages functional impairments are present.
One of the more recent approved medical treatments for MS patients is Alemtuzumab (product name Lemtrada), a humanized monoclonal antibody targeting CD52 cells, that depletes and repopulates B lymphocytes and T lymphocytes, causing sustained changes in the adaptive immunity. In 2013 and 2014 Alemtuzumab was approved in EU and USA, respectively.
With the exception of the MS Functional Composite z-score, the previous clinical studies investigating the effect of Alemtuzumab have exclusively focused on clinical parameters such as MRI indications of disease activity (accumulation of lesion, total and regional brain atrophy etc.), relapse-rates, changes in 'expanded disability status scale' (EDSS) and side-effects/adverse events. However, no previous studies have performed in depth monitoring on how physical or cognitive performance are affected following initiation of treatment with Alemtuzumab despite the paramount importance to patients.
The primary purpose of this project is to monitor the changes in physical performance during the first two years of treatment with Alemtuzumab in a well characterised Danish cohort of people with relapsing-remitting MS. A secondary purpose is to monitor the impact of Alemtuzumab treatment on cognition during the first two years of treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Change in maximal walking distance covered in 6 minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in maximal walking distance covered in 6 minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in maximal walking speed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in time to perform 5 times sit to stand test (5STS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in time to perform Timed Up and Go (TUG)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in time to perform 9-step stair climbing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in maximal walking speed while challenging coordination/balance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in aerobic power

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in isometric and dynamic knee extensor muscle strength, isometric hand grip strength

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in neural drive during maximal isometric knee extension

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total lower limb lean mass (kg) (assessed by Dual-energy X-ray Absorptiometry - DXA scan).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total lower limb fat mass (kg) (assessed by Dual-energy X-ray Absorptiometry - DXA scan).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total body lean mass (kg) (assessed by Dual-energy X-ray Absorptiometry - DXA scan).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total body fat mass (kg) (assessed by Dual-energy X-ray Absorptiometry - DXA scan).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in cognitive test assessing memory

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in cognitive test assessing processing speed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in accelerometer-based assessment of 24-hour physical activity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Estimation of disease severity by the Expanded Disability Severity Scale (EDSS scores: best 0 = normal neurological exam, worst 10 = death due to multiple sclerosis)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of relapses

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported questionnaire assessing impact of MS on walking ability (MSWS-12 scores: best 0, worst 100)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported questionnaire assessing impact of MS-induced fatigue on a persons life (MFIS total scores: best 0, worst 84; physical subscale scores: best 0, worst 36; cognitive subscale scores: best 0, worst 40; psychosocial subscale scores: best 0, worst 8)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported questionnaire assessing impact of MS on day-to-day life, from a physical perspective (MSIS-29 physical scale: best 0, worst 100 (greater impact of disease on daily function = worse health) and from a psychological perspective (MSIS-29 psychological scale: best 0, worst 100 (greater impact of disease on daily function = worse health)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported questionnaire assessing impact of MS on anxiety (scores: best 0, worst 21) and depression (scores: best 0, worst 21)

intervention.description: Alemtuzumab will be given two times, separated by 1 year.

study_pop.textblock: Multiple Sclerosis patients will be recruited from MS clinics all over Denmark.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical definite Multiple Sclerosis diagnosis according to the McDonald criteria
- About to commence alemtuzumab (Lemtrada) treatment
- Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) ≤ 5.5
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Co-morbidities that prevent participation in the project (dementia, serious cognitive disorders etc.)

overall_official.affiliation: Aarhus University, Health, Section for Sport Science

facility.name: Aarhus University, Health, Section for Sport Science
